Latest News:

International Restrictions:
*All travellers: If granted permission to enter of travel through Tonga, you will need to be fully vaccinated (normally defined as two doses – booster also preferred) and enter Tonga on a government run repatriation flight.
*If you’re fully vaccinated: If you’re fully vaccinated, before you travel to Tonga, you will need to present a supervised pre-flight negative Rapid Antigen Test (RAT) result. The RAT has to be conducted less than 24 hours before your departure to Tonga and you will have to provide the original test result certificate, issued by the supervising pharmacist/medical professional, when you check in for the repatriation flight. On arrival in Tonga, you will need to complete a period (currently 5 days) in Managed Isolation and Quarantine (MIQ) during which two PCR COVID-19 tests will be conducted. MIQ can either be in private accommodation, which requires Ministry of Health approval prior to travel, or at a government run facility. Guidance is available atthe Tongan Government’s portal. For government run locations, you will be required to pay for your MIQ.
At least 14 days must have passed since your second dose of the vaccine and the vaccine must be approved by the Ministry of Health.
*Proof of vaccination status: You must present proof that you have been fully vaccinated to enter Tonga.
Tonga will accept the printed version of proof of COVID-19 vaccination record and proof of COVID-19. They will not accept digital proof. Your final vaccine dose must have been administered at least 14 days prior to travel. Your appointment card from vaccination centres is not designed to be used as proof of vaccination and should not be used to demonstrate your vaccine status.
*If you’re not fully vaccinated: If you’re not fully vaccinated you are unlikely to be permitted to enter Tonga. You should contact the government of Tonga directly, (repatriationinfo@mic.gov.to) setting our your individual circumstances.
If you’ve had COVID-19 in the past year: If you’re fully vaccinated but test positive in your pre-flight Rapid Antigen Test, you will need to seek the Ministry of Health’s approval to travel. To apply for approval, send an email to the Tongan government’s Repatriation Team (repatriationinfo@mic.gov.to) containing a Certificate of Recovery and a Fitness to Fly Certificate, prepared by a General Practitioner less than 24 hours in advance of your flight’s departure. It is essential the information you provide also contains evidence of your previous COVID-19 infection.
You cannot use the COVID Pass to demonstrate proof of COVID-19 recovery when entering Tonga.
*Children and young people: Children aged 17 and under can follow the rules for fully vaccinated travellers to enter Tonga. Children aged 4 and under do not need to show proof of vaccination to enter Tonga.
*If you’re transiting through Tonga: Transiting is when you pass through one country on the way to your final destination.It is not currently possible to transit through Tonga.
*Exemptions: Any requests for an exemption to Tonga’s entry requirements should be sought via the Government of Tonga’s Repatriation Committee (email: repatriationinfo@mic.gov.to)


Internal Restrictions:
*Travel in Tonga: Tonga is currently subject to two States of Emergency and National COVID-19 Lockdown Restrictions.
A State of Emergency for Public Health was renewed by the government of the Kingdom of Tonga for the islands of Tongatapu, Vava’u and Ha’apai until midnight on Friday 15 July. A second State of Emergency, following the Hunga-Tonga Hunga-Ha’apai volcanic eruption, has also been renewed until 8am on 3 July 2022. The latter lists several Tongan islands, including locations on Tongatapu and Ha’apai, that members of the public are prohibited from entering during this period.
Under the National COVID-19 Lockdown Restrictions, Tonga operates a Traffic Light Framework which sets the baseline restrictions and timings of the overnight curfew on each island.
For more information on the States of Emergency and the National COVID-19 Lockdown Restrictions, including each island’s current Traffic Light status, you should check the latest declarations on the Government of the Kingdom of Tonga’s website. *Public places and services: The National COVID-19 Lockdown Restrictions may limit access and opening timings for public places including places of worship, restaurants, bars and nightclubs. For the latest information on each Tongan island, check the latest declarations on the Government of the Kingdom of Tonga’s website. *If you test positive for COVID-19, you may need to stay where you are until you test negative. You may also need to seek treatment there.
